item.title: Intellectual Property
item.description: According to the World Intellectual Property Organization, intellectual property “refers to creations of the mind: inventions; literary and artistic works; and symbols, names and images used in commerce”

item.title: Social Contract Theory
item.description: Social contract theory is the view that personsâ€™ moral and/or political obligations are dependent upon a contract or agreement among them to form the society in which they live.

item.title: Kant
item.description: The [[thoughts/ethics|ethical]] theory of the German philosopher Immanuel Kant Good will and the Categorical Imperative “What is always good without qualification?

item.title: Utilitarianism
item.description: Act Utilitarianism Also called the Greatest Happiness Principle. An action is good if its benefits exceed its harms, and an action is bad if its harms exceed its benefits.

item.title: Ethics
item.description: Ethics is the rational systematic analysis of morality. Morality is the compass of what people ought to or ought not to do, especially when it can cause benefit or harm to other people.
